page.title: 10RELIGION IN ERITH 1985
page.content: There are lots of different religions in the Erith area, non-Christian and Christian, which are for both the long established and more recently arrived peoples. Of the five Anglican churches, the oldest, which was the parish church, is St.John the Baptist, in West Street ,and has links with the first Domesday book. The original Catholic church was St.Fidelis, also in West Street. Both parish churches are further south today among the centres of housing. The other Christian churches scattered in the area are the Pentecostal, United Reform, Baptist and Christadel- phian churches. The non-Christian chuches are the Sikh temple in the West Street area among the Asians; the Jehovah's Witness hall near Erith station; and the Spiritualist church in Belvedere.
